intro: Maerua mildbraedii, commonly known as the Kalahari burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Maerua mildbraedii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
